title: Ticket #2819: fetchwork will claim existing dynamic slots but not allocate new ones
description:
The last we heard from Todd (and Pete before him), a fix has existed since Oct-2011 but is stalled on documentation.

This is important to us since SU would like to roll out partitionable slots + BOINC.

Goals:

  • 2012-06-08 - Initial assessment.

At the moment, fetchwork works, but it claims the partitionable slot itself, not a new dynamic slot. (It might also be willing to claim an unused dynamic slot, bu those typically fold back into the partitionable slot promptly.)

  1. When fetchwork runs, carve off dynamic slot instead of claiming the partitionable slot
    • Start looking in StartdHookMgr::handleHookFetchWork(FetchClient* fetch_client) (/src/condor_startd.V6/StartdHookMgr.cpp around line 228)
  2. When fetchwork runs succesfully, immediately try again.

Keywords: fetch work hook
remarks:
Updated priority to match Todd's new scheme (1=fire, 2=soon, 3=time permitting, 4=not yet prioritized, 5=wishlist/ideas).
